io.sphere.sdk.meta

Class ProductAttributeDocumentation

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.sphere.sdk.meta.ProductAttributeDocumentation

  • public class ProductAttributeDocumentation
extends java.lang.Object

    Introduction

    ProductType Creation

    A ProductType is like a schema how the product attributes are structured.

    ProductTypes contain a list of the attribute name and the corresponding type of the attribute. In one SPHERE.IO project the name type pair is global, so if you create an attribute "foo" of type String, you cannot create another ProductType where "foo" has another type like LocalizedStrings. If you do it anyway you get an error message like:

    "The attribute with name 'foo' has a different type on product type 'exampleproducttype'."

    ProductTypes have a name (String) which can be used as key to logically identify ProductTypes. Beware that the name has no unique constraint, so it is possible to create multiple product types with the same name which will cause confusion. Before creating a product type it's better to check if it already exists:

    final ProductTypeQuery query = ProductTypeQuery.of().byName(PRODUCT_TYPE_NAME);
final boolean productTypeAlreadyExists = client().execute(query).head().isPresent();

    See the test code.
